Mindflayer_Dead.synopsis: The player casts speak with dead on the corpse of the mind flayer that tortured them at the beginning of the game.
Mindflayer_Dead.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A- goto 295.11, 40.95, 36.01- Attack Dror Ragzlin through dialogue and kill all goblins with killcombat- Use Speak with Dead on the mind flayer’s corpse

Dead.synopsis: The player interrogates Dror Ragzlin's corpse about Z'Rell, Halsin, and Moonrise Towers. His N+1 info means he can be forced to talk even if the player killed him.

Scrying.synopsis:
The goblin king is about to conduct a ceremony in which he speak's with a mind flayer's dead body. He is a hobgoblin on a power trip, but still devoted to his god The Absolute. Like most goblins, he's not greatly intelligent, but a cut above the rest.

Pronunciation: Dror Ragzlin = Drawer RAGS-lin.

Z'Rell = Zuh-RELL. Other prinunciations in actor node field. 

Goblin language words should sound guttural and trashy.When they engage with Ragzlin, the player will experience a brief vision of him with an elf - this is teasing Ketheric Thorm, a later antagonist. Ragzlin will say he's looking for a weapon - the place will realise via narrator or mindmeld with Shadowheart that this is the gith artefact that she has.
Scrying.how_to_trigger: Approach Dror Ragzlin in the Goblin Camp:- loadlevel WLD_Main_A- goto 295.11, 40.95, 36.01

Attack_AssaultCustom.synopsis: Goblin king sees player commit a crime and initiates attack.

Mindflayer_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_20.text: *As the corpse rises, your parasite squirms in recognition.*
Mindflayer_Dead_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse animates to lifeInternalNodeContext: The corpse is animated in the Goblin Camp.

Mindflayer_Dead_27.speaker: Lae'zel
Mindflayer_Dead_27.text: Pa'vrylk! I feel it in me.
Mindflayer_Dead_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel clutches her head in painNodeContext: Pa'vrylk = PAH-vrill-ck. Ghaik = GAYK.

Mindflayer_Dead_14.speaker: Shadowheart
Mindflayer_Dead_14.text: Agh... my tadpole... it's just like on the ship...
Mindflayer_Dead_14.context: NodeContext: Wincing in discomfort as a the tadpole in her head reacts to a mind flayer corpse.

Mindflayer_Dead_34.speaker: Karlach
Mindflayer_Dead_34.text: Ugh... that thing is burrowing through my brain.

Mindflayer_Dead_2.speaker: Astarion
Mindflayer_Dead_2.text: No! Stop it! Stop it, you wretched worm!
Mindflayer_Dead_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Distressed, furious, maybe banging a hand against his head.NodeContext: Starts off scolding, but is very angry by the third line. This thing has invaded his head - Astarion has no tolerence for that.

Mindflayer_Dead_15.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_15.text: *There's no doubt - this creature is responsible for your parasite. And it's waiting for your questions.*
Mindflayer_Dead_15.context: NodeContext: For gith speakers: "Ghaik" is pronounced GAYK

Mindflayer_Dead_10.speaker: Player
Mindflayer_Dead_10.text: Tell me who the Absolute is.

Mindflayer_Dead_9.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_9.text: *Fractured images fill your mind: curved drow blades, crude goblin torches, gnoll teeth dripping blood.*

Mindflayer_Dead_29.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_29.text: *You see other mind flayers arranged in a serene circle. Absolute unity. Absolute power.*

Mindflayer_Dead_33.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_33.text: *Dark, empty pods flicker across your vision. They demand new flesh.*

Mindflayer_Dead_5.speaker: Player
Mindflayer_Dead_5.text: How do I get rid of this parasite?

Mindflayer_Dead_6.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_6.text: *You see the tadpole in the mind flayer's hand. Not a parasite: perfection.*

Mindflayer_Dead_8.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_8.text: *Rebirth is sloughing flesh. A new skull housing cold, sharp intellect.*

Mindflayer_Dead_32.speaker: Player
Mindflayer_Dead_32.text: Why did the dragon-riders attack the ship?

Mindflayer_Dead_3.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_3.text: *You watch through the creature's eyes as it curses the star-born slaves.*

Mindflayer_Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_17.text: *They want the ones from the ship. Darkness and sun, barely contained.*

Mindflayer_Dead_35.speaker: Player
Mindflayer_Dead_35.text: What does the Absolute want from the goblins?

Mindflayer_Dead_11.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_11.text: *You see Dror Ragzlin writhe. A tadpole clings to the mind flayer's fingers.*

Mindflayer_Dead_19.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_19.text: *The goblin king bows, obedient. The flesh of his tribe becomes the flesh of the Absolute.*

Mindflayer_Dead_18.speaker: Player
Mindflayer_Dead_18.text: Are there more of your kind nearby?

Mindflayer_Dead_12.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_12.text: *You see dark tunnels lit by noxious pools of brine. The darkness spreads through the earth.*

Mindflayer_Dead_0.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_0.text: *The sky splits open, and nautiloids pour out of a void that consumes the stars.*

Mindflayer_Dead_26.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_26.text: *The mind flayer's corpse twitches, then collapses again. It will speak no more.*

Mindflayer_Dead_23.speaker: Wyll
Mindflayer_Dead_23.text: Do you... do you feel it too?
Mindflayer_Dead_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll clutches his headNodeContext: Disturbed. Wants to know if you could feel the paraiste in your head too.

Mindflayer_Dead_28.speaker: Gale
Mindflayer_Dead_28.text: The tadpole stirs. It recognises its master...

Mindflayer_Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead_25.text: *The mind flayer's corpse twitches, then collapses again. It will speak no more.*

Dead_2.speaker: Narrator
Dead_2.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_0.speaker: Player
Dead_0.text: Why does the Absolute want the fugitives?

Dead_17.speaker: Player
Dead_17.text: What did you want with that mind flayer?

Dead_1.speaker: Player
Dead_1.text: Tell me where I can find a healer.

Dead_18.speaker: Player
Dead_18.text: Why are you and the drow working together?

Dead_13.speaker: Narrator
Dead_13.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Scrying_130.speaker: Player
Scrying_130.text: Goblins and drow, working together. But why?

Scrying_2.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_2.text: The Absolute's got room for everyone long as you don't defy Her. And nobody's that stupid.

Scrying_76.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_76.text: If the Absolute says to take orders from a drow, then we toe the mark, no questions.

Scrying_372.speaker: Player
Scrying_372.text: I'm in need of a healer.

Scrying_378.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_378.text: You look spiffy to me. What d'you need a healer for?

Scrying_326.speaker: Player
Scrying_326.text: Tell the truth. The mind flayers, the parasite - all of it.

Scrying_250.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_250.text: You're no True Soul. You're a damned heretic.

Scrying_161.speaker: Player
Scrying_161.text: I'm closing some gaps in my group. Everyone needs a healer.

Scrying_374.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_374.text: Well, let me know when you find one. Priestess Gut's better at causing pain than curing it.

Scrying_267.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_267.text: Not the time for it, hear?

Scrying_296.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_296.text: Shuugaan, a shuulkac. O taash okec dor.
Scrying_296.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation: "Shoe-gone, ah shool-cock. Oh tosh o-keck door."

Scrying_128.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_128.text: I command you, corpse: speak! Reveal truth to the Absolute!

Scrying_376.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera focuses on mind flayer corpse, which doesn't move.[Custom cameras required]

Scrying_221.speaker: Lae'zel
Scrying_221.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel looks at the mind flayer corpseNodeContext: For Lae'zel: Ghaik = GAYK.

Scrying_237.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_237.text: Nothing. Must be reading it wrong!

Scrying_245.speaker: Wyll
Scrying_245.text: This is the big boss. Strike him down.
Scrying_245.context: NodeContext: Not too loud, just forceful.

Scrying_255.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_255.text: *The hobgoblin turns to you, and the parasite squirms in your skull.*
Scrying_255.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should turn to player.

Scrying_270.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_270.text: *You taste the ale on his tongue and the bile in his soul.*

Scrying_303.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_303.text: *The visions cloud your inner eye for a brief moment once again. You see the hobgoblin, bowing before the armoured elf you'd glimpsed before.*
Scrying_303.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts to experiencing a mindmeldInternalNodeContext: Referring to a glimpse of Dror with Ketheric, one of the dead tribunal. This narrator node will ultimately be replaced or complimented by cinematics, once the necessary assets are available. This elaborates on a vision experienced during the 'Voice of Absolute' scene, which occurs before this on entering the goblin camp.

Scrying_152.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_152.text: *The elf speaks of the hunt for a great weapon, and the rewards that will go to whoever finds it. The hobgoblin's eyes gleam hungrily.*
Scrying_152.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts to experiencing a mindmeld

Scrying_450.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_450.text: Well, look here. A True Soul halfling. A long way from home, aren't you?

Scrying_86.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_86.text: Never saw a True Soul like you. But you got the Absolute's blessing.

Scrying_121.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_121.text: *He doesn't speak his next words, yet they still rattle your skull from within.*

Scrying_387.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_387.text: You ever talk to a dead squid? Now's your chance.
Scrying_387.context: CinematicNodeContext: This shouldn't be lip synched. Dror Ragzlin is speaking into your mind.InternalNodeContext: Sound effect: He is talking telepathically.

Scrying_206.speaker: Player
Scrying_206.text: I haven't made a habit of it.

Scrying_289.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_289.text: No time like the present, eh?

Scrying_170.speaker: Player
Scrying_170.text: What kind of ceremony is this?

Scrying_297.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_297.text: Guess you're a thick one, so I'll tell it straight: we're gonna make the carcass talk.

Scrying_213.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_213.text: Absolute says the dead squiddie had a weapon. I reckon the killer nabbed it and scooted off to that looter camp.

Scrying_72.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_72.text: We find who killed it, and we find who took that weapon. So settle in.

Scrying_396.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_396.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon the Absolute seeks - it's the artefact that she carries. The same one that protected you as you entered the goblin camp.*
Scrying_396.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

Scrying_282.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_282.text: *Her mind focuses - their suspicion cannot be aroused. They cannot discover that the weapon they seek is within their grasp.*
Scrying_282.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes flick over to Dror Ragzlin.

Scrying_269.context: CinematicNodeContext: The other companions share looks with each other - they've all picked up on Shadowheart's warning. Tav realises Dror is waiting for them.

Scrying_92.speaker: Player
Scrying_92.text: All right. Let the ceremony proceed.

Scrying_218.speaker: Player
Scrying_218.text: Study the corpse. Was this the mind flayer that tortured you?

Scrying_177.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_177.text: *Your skull sizzles with Ragzlin's displeasure. His mouth is still, yet you hear his demand.*

Scrying_327.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_327.text: I speak for the Absolute. And I say you stay.
Scrying_327.context: CinematicNodeContext: This is a telepathic line, so no lip syncing.

Scrying_4.speaker: Player
Scrying_4.text: Study the mind flayer. Could it be...?

Scrying_293.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera should examine the mind flayer corpse. [Custom camera]

Scrying_1.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_1.text: *This mind flayer's build is smaller, its garb plainer - a fearsome creature even in death, but not the one that tormented you.*

Scrying_48.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_48.text: *Yet it, too, roamed the nautiloid. It would have seen you, known you...*

Scrying_35.speaker: Player
Scrying_35.text: I know this magic. Hand me the scroll and I can do the talking.

Scrying_12.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_12.text: Then take it. Absolute knows I'm not getting anywhere.

Scrying_78.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_78.text: *You read aloud the words on the scroll.*
Scrying_78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king gives player a speak with dead scroll, and player reads the spell.

Scrying_426.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_426.text: Damn it. I saw it, too. And it tells me nothing!

Scrying_451.speaker: Player
Scrying_451.text: Why were the gith chasing the ship?

Scrying_151.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_151.text: *Suspicion floods Ragzlin's mind. Your brain howls as you consider your final question.*

Scrying_196.speaker: Player
Scrying_196.text: Why were the gith chasing the ship?

Scrying_209.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_209.text: *Ragzlin's mind rages. You have asked what no True Soul would dare.*

Scrying_345.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_345.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod. Darkness clears to reveal a face: yours.*

Scrying_131.speaker: Player
Scrying_131.text: What were you doing in Faerûn?

Scrying_87.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_87.text: *Curiosity conquers the hobgoblin's suspicions. You suck in a breath of relief...*

Scrying_392.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_392.text: *...and visions consume you once more. A swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*

Scrying_143.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_143.text: *Doubt clouds Ragzlin's skull. Might he suspect the truth?*

Scrying_32.speaker: Player
Scrying_32.text: What were you doing in Faerûn?

Scrying_381.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_381.text: *Ragzlin's mind is clouded by doubt, surprised once more by a question he didn't expect...*
Scrying_381.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should look surprised here.

Scrying_110.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_110.text: *Ragzlin frowns at a question he would never have asked.*
Scrying_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin king should look susprised here.

Scrying_66.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_66.text: *You feel Ragzlin's suspicions. A True Soul should never ask about the Master.*

Scrying_273.speaker: Player
Scrying_273.text: What were you doing in Faerûn?

Scrying_165.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_165.text: *Ragzlin scowls, shocked by a question you shouldn't have asked, and a jolt shoots through you.*
Scrying_165.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin king should look surprised here.

Scrying_91.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_91.text: I saw it, too. Gith on the hunt. They know something...

Scrying_262.speaker: Player
Scrying_262.text: Leave, before the mind flayer can identify you.

Scrying_65.speaker: Player
Scrying_65.text: Leave, before the mind flayer can identify you.

Scrying_149.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_149.text: *Your skull sizzles with Ragzlin's displeasure. His mouth is still, but you hear his demand.*

Scrying_446.speaker: Player
Scrying_446.text: It seems to me you've got an audience already.

Scrying_105.speaker: Player
Scrying_105.text: I'm staying. Go on with the ceremony.

Scrying_214.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_214.text: *You choke on black smoke as the hobgoblin bellows his incantation.*

Scrying_41.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_41.text: I command you, corpse: speak and say sooth. Lhuuc an ac akuul'dec shuulkokec!
Scrying_41.context: NodeContext: Pronunciation; "Luke an ock a-cool-deck shool-ko-keck."

Scrying_332.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_332.text: *The hideous corpse rises, tentacles writhing. The creature from the wreckage...*

Scrying_94.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_94.text: *Your heart seizes. Under questioning, the creature might recognise you as its killer.*

Scrying_50.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_50.text: *Your heart seizes. What if the creature noted your presence at the crash site?*

Scrying_423.speaker: Player
Scrying_423.text: Allow the hobgoblin to speak freely, lest he sense your intrusion.

Scrying_279.speaker: Player
Scrying_279.text: Dig into Ragzlin's mind and control the interrogation.

Scrying_67.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_67.text: *Ragzlin's mind reels, then calms. He will speak as you command.*

Scrying_197.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_197.text: *Ragzlin remains composed. If he senses your manipulations, he gives no sign.*

Scrying_79.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_79.text: *The creature responds - not in words, but memories.*

Scrying_440.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_440.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod - devoid of flesh, only darkness.*
Scrying_440.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here [Custom cameras]

Scrying_316.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_316.text: *Ragzlin remains ignorant to your presence in his mindmurk. You choose your next question:*

Scrying_313.speaker: Player
Scrying_313.text: 'Why were the gith chasing that ship?'

Scrying_244.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_244.text: Why were the gith chasing that ship?

Scrying_350.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_350.text: *You see dark tunnels lit by noxious pools of brine. The darkness spreads through the earth.*

Scrying_340.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_340.text: *The sky splits open, and nautiloids pour out of a void that consumes the stars.*

Scrying_56.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_56.text: *You see an image: curved drow blades, crude goblin torches, gnoll teeth dripping blood.*

Scrying_174.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_174.text: *Again, a vision comes to you. A memory, seen through the creature's soul-dead eyes.*
Scrying_174.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here

Scrying_84.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_84.text: You're kidding me! Very helpful, squid.

Scrying_195.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_195.text: *Suspicion floods Ragzlin's mind. Your brain howls as you force a final query into his throat.*

Scrying_102.speaker: Player
Scrying_102.text: 'Why were the gith chasing that ship?'

Scrying_355.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_355.context: InternalNodeContext: Sound effects should def. sound like a series of smacks on the floor when the tentacles fall.

Scrying_272.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_272.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod to reveal a face. Yours.*

Scrying_256.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_256.text: *Irritation eclipses his suspicions and Ragzlin's mind rests.*

Scrying_390.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_390.text: *Curiosity conquers his suspicions. You suck in a breath of relief...*

Scrying_192.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_192.text: *...and visions consume you once more. A swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*

Scrying_441.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_441.text: *Visions consume you once more - a swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*

Scrying_62.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_62.text: *Ragzlin pierces your mind, prodding for truth.*

Scrying_190.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ragzlin looks at you, and then anger comes over him.

Scrying_298.speaker: Player
Scrying_298.text: I would never deceive the Absolute's Right Hand.

Scrying_158.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_158.text: Right Hand, eh? Sounds like word's spreading!

Scrying_21.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_21.text: You're right. You're a real True Soul. I felt it.

Scrying_247.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_247.text: Riddles, all of it. And nothing to show for the trouble but rotting squid meat.

Scrying_448.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_448.text: No answers, no killer, and no damned weapon!

Scrying_399.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king looks away, pauses, then looks at you with a creepy smile.

Scrying_11.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_11.text: One failure to the next. Absolute'll have my damned head.

Scrying_234.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_234.text: Now get out, before I get the itch to take yours.

Scrying_74.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_74.text: The damned drow was right. And now she'll be grabbing the glory.

Scrying_148.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_148.text: You still here? Get yourself gone, before I show you my temper.

Scrying_301.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_301.text: Hmph. The damned drow was right. Can't let her get all the glory.

Scrying_398.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_398.text: The raid's started already. Let's hope she's in trouble and needs help.

Scrying_217.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_217.text: You - get to the grove. Help the drow Minthara kill the lot.

Scrying_189.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_189.text: Well don't just stand there. Move!

Scrying_386.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_386.text: Like I said - I got plans for you. Report to the drow. Minthara's the name.

Scrying_317.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_317.text: Seems I ain't done with you. Report to the drow. Minthara's the name.

Scrying_442.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_442.text: She's mounting an attack on that blasted grove. Tell her you'll join her.

Scrying_283.speaker: Player
Scrying_283.text: Can't you do your own dirty work?

Scrying_420.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king smiles creepily and brandishes his weapon.

Scrying_47.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_47.text: Say that again? 'Cause I know I didn't just hear you refuse the Absolute.

Scrying_199.speaker: Player
Scrying_199.text: Fine, fine. I'll talk to Minthara.

Scrying_153.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_153.text: Falling in line. Just what I like to see.

Scrying_178.speaker: Player
Scrying_178.text: You heard me. Talk to Minthara yourself.

Scrying_367.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_367.text: I don't need your lip. Boys. Crush them.

Scrying_439.speaker: Player
Scrying_439.text: My oath is to take vengeance, not orders from some cultist god.

Scrying_321.speaker: Player
Scrying_321.text: It's a mistake. I'm a True Soul, remember? We connected.

Scrying_233.speaker: Player
Scrying_233.text: I'm a faithful True Soul. Did you not feel our connection?

Scrying_141.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_141.text: Yeah, yeah - you're right. You're a real True Soul. I felt it.

Scrying_268.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_268.text: *Ragzlin's rage scorches your mind, hot and black. It squeezes you, suffocates you.*

Scrying_223.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_223.text: I won't take this disrespect lying down. I'm the boss! I'm the Absolute's Right Hand!

Scrying_103.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_103.text: What sorcery are you playing at? Boys - destroy them!

Scrying_126.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_126.text: *Your parasite resists, flailing as you crawl into Ragzlin's mindmurk.*

Scrying_248.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_248.text: *Rage slithers through him, hot and black. It squeezes you, suffocates you.*
Scrying_248.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should look angry.

Scrying_242.speaker: Player
Scrying_242.text: Correct. I took an oath to destroy monsters like you - and follow that oath I shall.

Scrying_281.speaker: Player
Scrying_281.text: Escape Ragzlin's mind and let him ask his own questions.

Scrying_431.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_431.text: *Another vision consumes you. A memory, seen through the creature's soul-dead eyes.*
Scrying_431.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here

Scrying_365.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_365.text: That can't be... Wait. Hold on.

Scrying_204.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_204.text: That's all you've got? Tell me what the killer looks like!

Scrying_352.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_352.text: *Another vision. You see a clawed hand open a holding pod...*

Scrying_277.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_277.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod to reveal... darkness.*

Scrying_26.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_26.text: *Doubt clouds Ragzlin's skull. Does he feel your guidance?*

Scrying_54.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_54.text: *Ragzlin's mind is clouded by doubt, surprised once more by words he didn't expect...*
Scrying_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should look surprised here.

Scrying_389.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_389.text: *Again, visions flow through you - a swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*

Scrying_308.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_308.text: *It is like fireworks in your skull. His trust is quickly waning.*

Scrying_388.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_388.text: You. Gith! What d'you know about this dead squiddie?

Scrying_287.speaker: Player
Scrying_287.text: None would dare deceive the Absolute's Right Hand.

Scrying_101.speaker: Player
Scrying_101.text: I don't know anything, but I'll have your head if you ask again.

Scrying_118.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_118.text: All right, all right. I shouldn't have questioned a True Soul like that.

Scrying_166.speaker: Player
Scrying_166.text: I'm a True Soul as well. How would I know more than you do?

Scrying_198.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_198.text: I am the Absolute's Right Hand. I will stand for no lies!

Scrying_280.speaker: Player
Scrying_280.text: I know it's about to be joined by a dead hobgoblin.

Scrying_299.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_299.text: *Ragzlin's mind is clouded by doubt, surprised by words he didn't expect...*
Scrying_299.context: CinematicNodeContext: Goblin king should look surprised here.

Scrying_239.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_239.text: *Another vision. You look back into the darkness of the pod aboard the nautiloid...*

Scrying_44.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_44.text: *...and the murk clears to reveal a face. Yours.*

Scrying_193.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_193.text: Tell me who killed you, freak. No games!

Scrying_55.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_55.text: *You see a clawed hand open a holding pod. The murk clears to reveal a face. Yours.*

Scrying_9.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_9.text: *Ragzlin frowns in confusion at a question he would never have asked.*
Scrying_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin king should look susprised here.

Scrying_112.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_112.text: *Then the creature speaks in visions: curved drow blades, crude goblin torches, gnoll teeth dripping blood.*

Scrying_329.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_329.text: *You see other mind flayers arranged in a serene circle. Absolute unity. Absolute power.*
Scrying_329.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here [Custom cameras]

Scrying_73.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_73.text: Damn it. That tells me nothing!

Scrying_276.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_276.text: *You feel Ragzlin's suspicions. He'd never have asked about his Master. You remain in control - barely.*

Scrying_111.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_111.text: What were you doing in Faerûn?

Scrying_315.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_315.text: *Ragzlin scowls, shocked by his own words, and a jolt shoots through your skull.*
Scrying_315.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin king should look surprised here.

Scrying_252.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_252.text: *The creature speaks in visions - a swarm of githyanki dragon-riders, silver blades held high.*
Scrying_252.context: CinematicNodeContext: Corpse should look at player here [Custom cameras]

Scrying_258.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_258.text: Gith on the hunt. They know something...

Scrying_18.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_18.text: *He is suspicious, confused by the question that fell from his lips. You proceed carefully...*

Scrying_212.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_212.text: Talk to me, freak. Who killed you?

Scrying_373.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_373.text: *The memory fades, and the corpse awaits the next question.*

Scrying_419.speaker: Player
Scrying_419.text: Let the hobgoblin continue the questioning.

Scrying_6.speaker: Player
Scrying_6.text: Penetrate Ragzlin's mind and take control.

Scrying_122.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_122.text: *Ragzlin's thoughts roil, then still. Your words will be his.*

Scrying_259.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_259.text: *You navigate carefully. With Ragzlin's voice, you ask...*

Scrying_339.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_339.text: *Ragzlin continues the interrogation, oblivious to your attempts to sway him.*

Scrying_369.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_369.text: *Ragzlin's mind resists your penetration. He speaks his first question.*

Scrying_379.speaker: Player
Scrying_379.text: Leave, before the mind flayer can identify you.

Scrying_63.speaker: Player
Scrying_63.text: Leave, before the mind flayer can identify you.

Scrying_136.speaker: Player
Scrying_136.text: I speak for the untamed wild - and I say enough. This ends here.

Scrying_16.speaker: Player
Scrying_16.text: It seems to me you've got an audience already.

Scrying_443.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_443.context: NodeContext: Bordering on anger at your resistance to joining the relgious ceremony. Should sound creepy.

Scrying_7.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_7.text: And there's no True Soul yet who turned their back on the Absolute.

Scrying_181.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_181.text: *You realise that the weapon the hobgoblin speaks of is the artefact you carry. You cannot let them discover it - no matter what.*
Scrying_181.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH avatar glances down at her side (as if towards where the box is) then back to Dror

Scrying_77.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_77.text: *You suddenly feel a strange anxiety take hold - not your own, but that of the artefact you carry. Somehow, it's afraid...*
Scrying_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

Scrying_210.speaker: Narrator
Scrying_210.text: *The artefact does not want to part from you. It does not want to fall into the Absolute's clutches.*
Scrying_210.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks up, eyes flick over to Dror Ragzlin

Scrying_82.speaker: Player
Scrying_82.text: Settle in to watch the proceedings.

Scrying_295.speaker: Player
Scrying_295.text: Scroll, incense... Do you mean to speak with this corpse?

Scrying_75.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_75.text: Damn right - I'm gonna make this carcass talk.

Scrying_414.speaker: Player
Scrying_414.text: No, but I'll happily leave it a dead hobgoblin for company.

Scrying_421.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying_421.text: If it isn't another True Soul.

Scrying_370.speaker: Wyll
Scrying_370.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll looks at the mind flayer corpse

Attack_AssaultCustom_0.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Attack_AssaultCustom_0.text: You defile the Absolute's name. Boys!
